Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: LjubicaZubica
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights with my friends. We booked a room with 5 beds, but instead we got rooms with 3 and 2 beds for the same price which was ok. We paid 37 EU a night each. It is a small and a very old hotel, needs a renovation but it is clean and comfortable. Each room has a bathroom and a TV. Bathrooms are tiny but who cares as long as the shower and toilet work. Staff is ok, except if it is 8:55 and you are still in the breakfast room (breakfast is served from 7.30 to 9.00).The breakfast itself is not spectacular but you won't end up hungry. The location is great-few minutes walk from Earl's Court station which is 4-5 stations away from Victoria Station and Leicester Square. If you are staying for a night or two and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room-go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A bug's life”
Reviews.Author: bozzone
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable location, just 200 mt away from Earl's court station, 10 minutes walking by High streett Kensington. Bad furniture, poor breakfast. During the breakfast they hoover besides our feet. No soap in the private bathroom. The WC didn't work. The locker room does not exist:there's just a chain to join all the suitcases!!! I found bedbugs in my bed and they change my room. The manager, very ugly person, said it was my fault and i carried with my suitcase and they have no responsibility. I said the this is not a good way to speak with a customer but he was upset... London is dirty but this is too much

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel new to all important places”
Reviews.Author: djwolfde
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a Hotel road near the station Earls Court. The stuff is very friendly and helps u by all the kinds you want to do. Close to Piccadilly and easy to reach from Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in my life”
Reviews.Author: Shizuka J
Reviews.Content: Due to a last minute notice, I booked this hotel online for a night stay in London for work. I only booked because of the location. It cost £96 for one night for a twin bed room. The room is in unbelievably bad condition and very old, very very small. It's even much worse than my student room of 11 square meters. The wall is paper thin. You can easily hear people next door talking and footsteps from the corridor. Uncomfortable and noisy beds and I was even bitten by bed bugs. Shower is also in bad condition and hot water is not consistent. Interesting shampoo, soap and shower gel all in one in a dispenser on the wall, nothing else in the bathroom. Breakfast only has toast, ham and cheese and that's it. This is the worst hotel I've stayed in my whole life. I will not go there ever again. I will NOT recommend this hotel to any other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a lot given some of the poor reviews but I was absolutely blown away by how good Mowbray Court Hotel was. The staff were friendly, attentive and helpful in all manner of ways. Yes the rooms are basic, but if you are in London why would you spend all your time in your hotel bedroom. I had a twin single room and was sharing with a friend and it was absolutely fine. We had a great window overlooking the street below and the hotel location meant it was quiet at night. The proximity to Earl's Court Station means that it is only a short ride to all the scenic sights of London and there are also some good pubs and restaurants in the area. The breakfast provided was all that you needed to start your day (e.g. museli, toast, croissants and fruit) and (again) the friendly staff are waiting on hand to grab you more coffee or hot chocolate as you wish. Who cares if the hotel needs a renovation, that's not your problem as a traveler. Enjoy the Mowbray for what it is, a simple but excellent place to accommodate yourself whilst in London! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Matthew T
Reviews.Content: Staff were the only saving grace. The hotel is old and run down. It is noisy and very smelly. The rooms are very small. I don't think any work has been done on the hotel sinch the 70's. I was there for work and had breakfast paidd for, I would not pay for breakfast and would get a decent breaakfast from the pub just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!! keep away!!”
Reviews.Author: Milos_info
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during September 2011. Hotel staff was generally speaking helpfull and they try to keep hotel clean apart from an old man 60+ who was around during breakfast. However, the hotel needs complete renovation AS SOON AS POSSIBLE corridors & rooms have a disgusting odour, the washbasin was cracked and broken in several places (health issues). The window does not locked(security problems). The room's furniture seems to be 30-40 years old. The whole site seems to be like Mr Bean's movies. I have been during the last 6 years in more than 35 hotels across UK it is the first hotel without tea/coffee making facilities. The room/bed are really small. Furthermore I paid Â£96 for double bedroom(165 cm!!!!) when some of my friends paid Â£40-Â£48 for the same quality hotel. The breakfast served from 07:30-09:00 it is very unusual for a hotel to serve the breakfast only 1 hour and 30 minutes..!!!! The only problem reagarding the staff was an old man; when the time reaches 09:00 he was staying over our table and by force he collect all the plates without asking.... Just show us the clock and said us ''move on it is 09:00AM'' To summarise NEVER AGAIN OVERPRICED-OVERPRICED-OVERPRICED!!!!!! KEEP AWAY there are much better hotel in the same price!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Minimad123
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Mowbray Court Hotel on the 23rd of September and it seemed a bit hit and miss. It was easy to find (hit) however payment was demanded upfront (miss). Though it was really cheap for London and had the best reviews as being as close as it was to the Expo centre I still felt I would have got a bit more for my money. Even though there was only two of us they put us in a family room. The double bed was right on the oposite site to the room of the small on the wall box television (with no remote). We were told by reception breakfast would be between 7:30 and 9, which shortly followed a snide comment of "though you two will probably be out all night." The room was very cold come the next morning and the lock was stiff too. I rate it a average because of the price but honestly, the room just need some magnolia paint, ASDA/Tesco Value buy plain sheets, couple of ikea wardrobes and its going to start feel more comfortable, Â£100-Â£150 renovating 1 room per month - its doable.

Reviews.Title: “What a hole! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: DonegalAnon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2010 for 1 night with 2 friends. We booked it last minute for a shopping trip and we weren't expecting much but wat a kip this place turned out to be! Now we aint fussy but this really tool the biscuit! There were 3 of us sharing a room which had a double bed and a single bed. When two of us got into the double bed the thing felt like it was about to collapse! The bathroom was so small that if u stood in the middle u could reach all four walls just by putting your arms out! My airing cupboard at home is bigger! There was also chewing gum stuck on the wall beside our bed which was proof that the rooms wasnt cleaned too well! We made do with this hotel as we were just there for the one night on a flying visit but I can sa for sure that we will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: G V
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the staff and their efforts to answer our questions about activities but the room size and lack of power outlets had me wondering how they continue to be in business. Overall the rooms were neat but clean isn't a word I would use. The rooms didn't appear to have had a deep cleaning in a long while. The carpets were dirty and I didn't want to walk around without socks on my feet. The shower was not big enough and the commode didn't work well. The walls are thin and I could hear conversations and other activities in the rooms around me. I don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: ek_84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2011 while traveling through London for a few nights. After hearing horror stories about cheaper London accommodation I was prepared for the worst, but ended up being pleasantly surprised. I booked a single room with shower, it was very basic, but comfortable & clean. Room included clean towels, soap, extra blankets and all the basic you would expect. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room price included breakfast (which skipped most days - pasty from down the road was far more tastier!) The best thing about the hotel is the location - 5 min walk from the Earl's court station which puts you right on the Piccadily line, which is very easy if you're coming straight from Heathrow, and the District line, M&S down the road for cheap eats and all the usual High Street stuff on your doorstep. The worst thing about the hotel - the price! Relative to other cities it is very expensive for what you get, but that is something that has to be dealt with if you want to stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “Small and pokey”
Reviews.Author: AngeAus
Reviews.Content: Ideally located around the corner from Earl's Court Underground, this hotel is clean but the room we had was very very small. The suitcases had to be opened on the bed as there was no other floor space, and then be placed upright on the floor when we were sleeping/sitting on the bed. The noise from the Underground was quite loud. On the positive side, the continental breakfast included in the cost was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over the world including some grotty ones. While the staff were friendly I found the place very run down in need of refurbishment. The "ensuite room " was hardly big enough to turn a cat round and the "ensuite" was a "Tardis" in the corner of the room, but unlike the "Tardis" was not big inside. The breakfast room reminded me of a transport cafe and the bar very much the same. The continental breakfast was good including fresh fruit. It is OK for back packers and the like but for over 65's it is not what I would expect. However you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, expected more value though...”
Reviews.Author: kitwalker_devil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of March. Getting to the hotel from Gatwick Airport was easy thanks to the underground. On check in I found that the room was very very small - I had stayed in other 3 star hotels in Europe but this was smallest by far and cost more than any of the european hotels. I spoke to the nice young gentleman who was on the night reception and he gladly was able to shift my wife and myself to what he believed was the biggest double room available - this was much better than the first room! Breakfast was adequate with breads, scones, cereals, fruits, juice, coffee and tea. The service by all was very good. Wifi though was very pricey - I paid double for 1 hour than I have for 24 hours at other places. Overall - if you're looking for a convenient location close to the underground with planty of good eats around (and a DIY laundromat) then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: oakbridge1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. Room comfortable and clean. Breakfast very adequate. Location excellent.. At the price I paid it iwas good value. Only complaint is the price of internet. In this day and age wi-fi should be free. If little cafes and b&bs in Costa Rica can offer free wi-fi, why cant London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Completely saved us”
Reviews.Author: EmmaMary213
Reviews.Content: After a truly shocking experience with the Hotel Boka in London, we had to drag our luggage up and down Earl's Court looking for a room for the next six nights when all of London was booked out for Wimbledon. We came across the Mowbray Court Hotel, and the most wonderful woman on the desk, who did everything she could to find us a room even though the hotel was basically booked out. She found us a room for every night bar one, and even offered to give us a place to sleep at her house for that night (We found a room at the Ibis in Wembley for that one night eventually). The hotel was in a great location, so close to the tube station in Earl's Court. There was also a Marks and Spencers down the road for food, and lots of fast food places around the corner. I would advise everyone to ask to stay in the main building as it is the only one with a lift, and all the rooms we stayed in (3 different rooms) had some little thing wrond with them (Eg broken door handle), however the staff were almost all truly helpful, the breakfast was great and again, the location was also great. Most of all, the lengths that the woman on the desk on our first night went to so that we had a room was amazing, and any small problems added charm more than anything. It is a cheaper hotel though, so be warned that there are lots of backpackers meaning a fair bit of late night noise in some instances.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located hotel, extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: globalhorserider
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot for your very friendly welcome and all your help. Corinne and Sacha

Reviews.Title: “Okay just to sleep”
Reviews.Author: gingin41
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The rooms were very tiny but for sleeping it was okay. Just not enough room to move around in especially with 2 people in the room. The continental breakfast was adequate. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. It was clean but it does need to be upgraded. Considering the price, for London it works, and the location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: Somerzetvisitor
Reviews.Content: I keep trying to find another place to stay that is of comparable cost. Frankly they either seem foreign due to language or stink and need a good rebuild. I have to be practical as well on where I need to visit. With the tube around the corner and it does not matter which way you turn on leaving the hotel you will get connected. Plenty of shops and pubs within a 2 minute walk. I think this is good basic value and the staff do help as much as they can. You wont get a full English fried breakfast but I have never left here feeling empty. If you wish to visit the ideal home of anything at Earls Court this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighbourhood, but a little run down.”
Reviews.Author: ryansg
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Very convenient location just a short walk from Earl's Court, where there are supermarkets, food shops and internet cafes abound. Relatively clean. The reception/ service staff are cheery. Breakfast is in a nice little room. Minus: Rundown No FREE wifi (internet place down the street charges 50p per 30 minutes) No lift up the 4 flights of stairs Shower was a little clogged.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, but no more.”
Reviews.Author: deoboed
Reviews.Content: The price was right for a triple room-- very hard to come by in London in the summer, and it came out to just over 100 USD. The triple was a large room in the "basement" but there were 2 full sized windows. One bed was a queen size, the other two were singles, so this would have been a great family room. The bathroom was clean. My only complaint was that the basement room smelled quite strongly of basement-- not mold, not stuffy, not BAD, exactly, but like a cool damp basement in the summer, which is what it was. For things nearby-- the Earls Court station is a very quick walk. There is a Tesco and a Wagamama nearby as well. The street it is on is pretty much wall to wall hotels, which is fine. Breakfast was coffee, tea, juice, cereal, milk, fruit, ham (warm), croissant, and toast. The front desk staff was very nice. I left a box set of DVDs in my room accidentally and when I came back later they were at the desk waiting for me. The "locked storage" for luggage is actually just a chain on the wall in an unlocked hallway. At the end of your day the person getting your bag might not be the one who chained it up, so there is the risk of some random person pointing and saying "that one is mine" and taking your bag, but all was well. In all, big room, convenient location, great price, honest helpful staff. Bit of a strange smell, but very clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand why people give this hotel 3 or 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: PJS999
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel the other day (April). - the rooms are dirty - the decor is very run down and scuffed - There were loads of human hairs in my blanket - I had to use the blanket as there was not heating in the evening in the room and it was freezing! - The TV reception is appaling and every station is fuzzy (I had two rooms because of this and can confirm that it is not isolated to just one room) - there is no kettle or tea/sugar in teh rooms at all. you can hire a kettle but then you have to go out and buy your own coffee. Even a Â£20 B&B in the UK has this. I can forgive most things for a London hotel room at Â£70 per night but the above are all basic essentials and this is therefore unforgivable. AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not well maintained and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Maddy_England09
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel was its location. It is very close to Earls court tube station in a nice area which connects directly to Tower Bridge, Heathrow Airport, and other important tourist places. I stayed in an ensuite double room (Â£80 per night) which was were very small and looked cheap. Duvet cover was cheap and dirty and the bathroom was very small. It is certainly not recommended for couples. I would advice it is worth exploring a better place outside Zone 1 at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful â€“ expect no luxury”
Reviews.Author: owl121
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mowbray Court for a few nights last summer. I was looking for a budget hotel in Earls court area and chose is after a Google search. The hotel is a basic budget hotel and would suit backpackers, budget tourists & younger people interested in nightlife. It may not suit families with young children, business travellers or older people. (1) The hotel was clean- I often saw cleaners at work (2) The rooms were very small. The en suite toile very small. Both clean. (3) The stairs are steep and creaky, especially the stairs down to the basement breakfast room. They would be difficult to manage for a elderly person. There is a working lift. (4) Breakfast was very basic, cardboard like muesli, croissant, toast, and budget priced cheese and potted meat. The breakfast room which was in the basement was very large but if you arrive between 8.30-9.00 you may not get a seat. (5) The staff were always polite and helpful, especially Peter. There was someone at reception at whatever hour I arrived. The main problem is that it is very noisy at the back of the hotel which is very close to the Earls Court tube station. Trains start at 6am!! Do not expect to get any sleep after this time if your room is at the back of hotel. In short this is a basic budget hotel in a safe area with a great nightlife. If you are looking for luxury try somewhere else. Because of the noise from the tune station I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God - Dont Bother”
Reviews.Author: Avensi
Reviews.Content: Firstly I need to point out that I have wrote reviews on this website before and I am always honest and I have never had to write a bad review, thatâ€™s going to change. Cost: For a twin room it was Â£85 per night, good price for the location. However for an extra Â£10 you can stay in a modern and classy hotel 10 mins away. It is way over priced, search for other hotels in this budget. Location: Location is the only positive thing about the hotel, that said 10 mins away are better hotels with better facilities. Deco: The hotel was out dated, it has not had any improvements since 1985. The room was very very basic, 2 x camping beds, a broken Tv and a wardrobe that wouldnâ€™t open. Plus there are 2 entrances to this hotel, its just strange. Clean: The hotel reception desk is not that bad if I am honest however with the dated deco and the pitiful sizes of room it would be easy to hide the dirt. The room was clean(ish), the bathroom was horrible, the toilet had not been cleaned since the last occupants which was very nice as they left a little gift. I do not expect this especially when we checked in at 6pm. The bathroom was small, cold, mouldy, broken and dangerous tiles with poor water pressure. Staff: 2 words, freaky and weird. Seriously you may be thinking that I am being unfair, but people im not. For the British guest think of the Rik Mayel Film Guest House Paridiseo . . SIMPLY HORRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and hassle-free”
Reviews.Author: budge185
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for seven nights on my recent visit to London. It was my second stay at this hotel, the first being in November 2006. London is such a big city and hotels are generally very expensive, so I decided to book the same again because my first experience was good. Mowbray Court Hotel is literally around the corner from Earl's Court tube station, which is a really convenient location as the station is served by a few lines, making it super easy to get to various parts of London. If you're not afraid of walking, Kensington and Notting Hill are not that far either. Earl's Court Rd has quite a few restaurants, a Boots pharmacy and supermarkets, and there's also a cheap internet cafe right across the road from the station. The hotel is a bit shabby but everything is clean and the staff are so friendly, it's a nice place to stay. For one person, the room was very comfortable in size, although the shower is quite small. Breakfast was included in my rate and the selection of cereals, fruit, cheese/ham/tomato and toast/delicious croissants was nice and a great way to fill up before a day of sightseeing. This hotel isn't going to win any awards for presentation but it's a reliable, affordable option in an expensive part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msusmilesalot
Reviews.Content: Mowbray Court is located about 1/2 block away from the Earls Court Underground Station. The neighborhood is safe and there are several pubs right by the Underground. The room we stayed in was adequate. It was quite plain and resembled a dorm room a bit but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The desk staff was VERY helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: gasprina
Reviews.Content: Hi I would like to tell u that the hotel is good to stay in for short while. We were in the other block so we have to get out every morning to take breakfast. In that block there is no lift and we were on the upper level: the forth storey. We were booked a quad room and we hadn't so one of us had to sleep alone. Over all we have to share the bathroom with other persons of the same storey. But the staff is very ok and the hotel is very clean.. Thank you I would come again if I am going to stay in London for short while. From Malta.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Oasis”
Reviews.Author: rroses
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to London and we spent the first six nights in a very sad 4th floor walk-up near King's Cross. But we survived and after a side trip to Bath and York came back to London to the Mowbray. What a contrast-and a few $ cheaper. We were welcomed by the staff, given a delightful and roomy room and served a nice breakfast each morning (in contrast to our rice krispies, white toast and canned fruit for 6 mornings--ugh!). How we wish we had stayed at the Mowbray first. But both were rated the same, had a very similar price and were very close to the Underground. We would love to bestow another star on the Mowbray based on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: jessaharris
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They were wonderful throughout our stay giving us great advice and helping us with any issues we had. My friend and I booked a room with a double bed. We had to share the bathroom down the hall with other rooms (which neither of us were too fond of), but it was kept clean and our schedules rarely conflicted with those in the other rooms. We were pleasantly surprised that our room had a balcony. It turned out to be a great place to people-watch, smoke and to keep our drinks cold ;-) All in all, I think that anyone on a limited budget would be happy staying at the Mowbray.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust83
Reviews.Content: the hotel is reasonably priced considering its in london, and in zone 1, right by the earls court tube station. my room had breakfast included but i never woke up early enough to have it so i wont comment on that.... the staff were average, not going out of your way to make your stay comfortable, but i cant fault them either. the rooms were generally clean although the TV and radio both look like they came out of the 70s....my biggest gripe about this place would be the fact that their sink is tiny! its such a huge inconvenience that i can only imagine most establishments take for granted. it was hardly big enough for both my hands to fit to get water for my face. now, i am not a big girl at all (im of average asian size) so i found it ridiculous that i couldnt do something as basic as face washing, in a pleasant way. there is some noise that filters through from the street but the upside of this is that the location is good all around as you dont have to walk very far to anywhere....

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: MikkeStockholm
Reviews.Content: I visited the Mowbray in the beginning of July. First I had a small room at the front, then my sister came and we shared a twin room (turned out to be a three-bed room) at the back of the hotel for a couple of nights. Both rooms were clean and the service was good. The room at the front was a bit noisy ( from the street) but that was no problem with the other room (facing against the Earlâ€™s C station). We could even sleep with the window open all night without getting disturbed! The breakfast was above average I have been served on an English hotel. Different kind of cereals, tea/coffee, toasts and fresh fruit. Of course it was not an proper English breakfast but most foreigners donâ€™t want that anyway. One morning the shower ran out of hot water though. The staff was very helpful and friendly. And the short walk to the Underground station, and the area around Earlâ€™s Court (with lots of small restaurants, pubs and local food stores) are great! As I donâ€™t want to spend too much money on my accommodation I think Mowbray is a good hotel for that price, and the next time I visit London I might stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “At least I didn't pay for it”
Reviews.Author: dizzyduckCheshire
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were placed here on a business trip, so we had no say in where we stayed. As we were working and not tourists, it was not the ideal place to stay. The time we spent there that week, the hotel seemed to be occupied by noisy Italian and American backpackers; which would not have been too much of a problem if the walls were not paper thin. Having to get up at 5am every morning for work was difficult after only 2 hours sleep. The rooms were very basic, but clean. We only had a wash basin in the room. (not all rooms are en suite) and the communal bathroom was not particularly attractive. My colleague's room door did not open fully due to the bed being in the way and in my other colleague's room, none of 3 of the electrical sockets were working. One evening the lights did not work in our rooms, but then came back on at approximately 1am. To which there was no explaination. The windows in the room were single glazed-which is not ideal for busy central London which creates a lot of noise- mostly from low flying planes into Heathrow (every 20 seconds), as well as the usual traffic and Tube noises. Our company paid for bed and breakfast, however, breakfast was not served until 7.30am which we found to be too late for our needs. And the one day I took breakfast there, I found it to be simple and a bit strange. It was the first time I had ever seen sliced tomatoes as a breakfast dish. The staff were helpful and polite although resturaunt staff do not always speak english. One of the reception staff was especially helpful and had a good sense of humour referring to our rooms as the "prison cell" and "honeymoon suites" respectively. He was not joking in the scheme of things. We were there on a business trip which was not being paid for by ourselves, so I am not sure if he would have used this same humour on actual tourists. It was very well located close to the tube station and lots of food outlets. It was good it was paid for by my company, because I would have been very dissapointed if I had been a tourist and paid Â£50 per night for it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Musty, Fusty And Dusty - Don't Bother !”
Reviews.Author: SallyFrance
Reviews.Content: wE STAYED in March - and certainly could have done better. The rooms were musty and dusty - and VERY overpriced - and we suffered noise from the train station closeby. Above all we were approached by runners at the local station who told us how great the place was and almost pulled us there. Beware ! - any place which needs to use the services of runners - begs the question why? The staff were friendly - but that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Grand for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Irish_smile_82
Reviews.Content: This is a grand hotel, very close to tube station. It is typical of most london hotels in an average persons price range. Yes it does need some cosmetic work done, but overall, very clean, very friendly and helpful, and very central. The breakfast is not great, even by continental breakfast standards, but its closeness to Earls Court tube station more than made up for this. You could be in central london in ten mins. Would reccommend for short stays only, as more comfort would be needed for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: redlisab
Reviews.Content: We are 3 girls from Cork in Ireland and we stayed here from 26-29 Nov. We had travelled for the george Michael concert (which was excellent by the way), and chose this because it was excellent value and it was located in Earls court. Little did we know how close it actually it was to the venue, less than a minute around the corner, and same distance from tube. The staff were excellent, and very friendly. Continental breakfast was included. the rooms may not be like 5* hotels, but neither are you paying outrageous prices. In all the times we have stayed in london, and we travel a few times a year for shopping and gigs, have we come across nicer staff. Anyone travelling on a budget should stay here, and if one is going to a gig in Earls court, it is ideal. To all the staff, thanks, we will be back. Anyone who likes their beds turned down etc, dont bother, pay the high prices elsewhere. Regards, Angela, Deirdre and Litlle Niamh of Holy God.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good B&B”
Reviews.Author: ivyc1116
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time travelling to UK. We stayed there on our 1st night arrival in London. We took the underground from Heathrow Airport to Earl's Court. The location of the B&B is around 5 mins from the underground station. It is quite convenient and easy to get to. There are two different building, one is older and the other is relatively new. The reception area located in the new building and our rooms are in the older one. The reception is very nice to us, informative and helpful. A nice guy anyway. We stayed in en-suite rooms at the 2nd floor, we have 6 people in total, staying in 2 different rooms. The environment of the two rooms are quite distinctive. Both included 1 double bed and 1 single bed. However, one of the room is very small, just enough to place the beds and no more spaces left. The bathroom is small as well. The other is better, the room is bigger and the bathroom includes a bath as well. But we satisified with these anyway. The breakfast is good. Toast, Coaissant, ham and cheese, fresh tomatos and fruit, milk, cereal, tea and coffee, etc. A nice breakfast before we check-out.

HotelInfo.Name: Mowbray Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28/32 Penywern Road | Earl's Court, London SW5 9SU, England
